channel.title: [PI]Grand Exchange[PI]
channel.description: how can make a button count up like a grand exchange button please help! like i click a +1 button it shows in a are +1 and if i click it again it goes up 2 and so on, i want it similar like this for other buttons.

item.title: [PI]Grand Exchange[PI]
item.dc:creator: @manny458 manny458
item.description:
@manny458 wrote:

[quote=".:, post:7, topic:464743"][quote author=manny458 link=topic=568861.msg4128611#msg4128611 date=1350781624]

Create an integer and have it add to or subtract from the value every time the action button is activated.

can you make me a example and where should this go please

Create an integer to represent the amount the item currently holds, then wherever the button is handled simply have it add or subtract from the integer.

Declare a new integer which will hold the item value.

public static Integer itemPrice;

Would add one to the value.

itemPrice ++;

would subtract one from the value.

itemPrice --;

Would set the value to five or the value you put in.

itemPrice = 5;

That’s the basic concept but once you get to adding support for multiple item values you may have to hold the values within an array.

where can i declare this integer?
[/quote]

In the Player class would be best. Underneath another Integer (int).[/quote]

src\server\model\players\Player.java:157: error: ';' expected public boolean itemPrice ++; ^ src\server\model\players\Player.java:158: error: ';' expected public boolean itemPrice --; ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

That’s the basic concept but once you get to adding support for multiple item values you may have to hold the values within an array.
[/quote]

In the Player class would be best. Underneath another Integer (int).

itemPrice ++;

Would set the value to five or the value you put in.

That’s the basic concept but once you get to adding support for multiple item values you may have to hold the values within an array.
